content:
• Tuesday, May 29, 2012
  • UDR

    UDR (NYSE:UDR) files a 19M share secondary offering. The company plans to use the proceeds to...

    UDR (NYSE:UDR) files a 19M share secondary offering. The company plans to use the proceeds to redeem preferred stock and pay down debt. BofA Merrill Lynch and JP Morgan will serve as joint book-runners for the offering. Shares -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 PM
  • PWRD

    More on Perfect World's Q1: The company effectively blames its FQ1 miss on a lull ahead of 2H...

    More on Perfect World's Q1: The company effectively blames its FQ1 miss on a lull ahead of 2H game launches, along with lower promotional activity. It looks as if this lull has worsened in Q2: Perfect World is guiding for Q2 revenue of $101.9M-$107.6M, well below a consensus of $123.3M. PWRD -10.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRYS

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q1 EPS of -$0.11 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $247.5M (+19% Y/Y) misses...

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q1 EPS of -$0.11 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $247.5M (+19% Y/Y) misses by $20M. Shares -3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -7.9%) had a rough day. Not only did shares make new post-IPO lows thanks to...

    Zynga (ZNGA -7.9%) had a rough day. Not only did shares make new post-IPO lows thanks to Facebook's selloff and the end of another share lockup (this one covers 325M shares), the company lost mobile gaming CTO Laurent Desegur to startup Game Closure. Zynga is now down 39% from its IPO price of $10.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q1 EPS of $0.72 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $114.1M (+3% Y/Y)...

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q1 EPS of $0.72 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $114.1M (+3% Y/Y) misses by $2.8M. Shares -14.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) says the FDA has advised the company it must complete an...

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) says the FDA has advised the company it must complete an integrated safety analysis of completed studies of oral Proellex. Once completed, the report must be submitted to the FDA for review prior to any additional oral trials. Shares -5.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading, and is now down 11.2% AH, making new multi-year...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading, and is now down 11.2% AH, making new multi-year lows in the process. With rumors already in place about the hiring of strategic advisers, and a sale not mentioned among the options RIM claims JPMorgan and RBC will advise on, investors are focusing on RIM's guidance for an FQ1 loss.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 7 Comments
  • BHC

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG) -8.8% AH after issuing downside FQ3 guidance, seeing EPS of $0.04-$0.06...

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG) -8.8% AH after issuing downside FQ3 guidance, seeing EPS of $0.04-$0.06 vs. $0.08 consensus and revenues of $14.4M-$14.7M vs. $16.25M consensus; ophthalmic sales are expected to drop ~9% Y/Y. SURG cites difficulties in Europe, which is depressing demand for ophthalmic disposables and exerting an unfavorable foreign currency impact.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) shares are halted after the company provides a business update in...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) shares are halted after the company provides a business update in which it says it has hired JPMorgan and RBC to assist with a "strategic review" that will cover licensing and partnership opportunities, and "strategic business model alternatives." A prior report claimed RIMM was leaning towards hiring JPM. RIM also says it expects to report an operating loss for FQ1 (ends June 2), citing both lower volumes and tough pricing - analysts currently expect EPS of $0.43.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 16 Comments
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +10.9%) closes with a big gain after Gilford Securities starts coverage with a Buy...

    VirnetX (VHC +10.9%) closes with a big gain after Gilford Securities starts coverage with a Buy and $65 PT (nearly twice VirnetX's current price). The firm expects VirnetX's encryption IP, currently the subject of a patent infringement suit filed against Apple, Cisco, and others, will result in licensing deals with 4G hardware vendors. SA's J.P. Maven recently took a look at key upcoming dates related to VirnetX's legal disputes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CMG

    Chipotle (CMG +3.5%), Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +1.9%), and Panera Bread (PNRA +1.4%) all post...

    Chipotle (CMG +3.5%), Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +1.9%), and Panera Bread (PNRA +1.4%) all post gains as the trio continues to trade at streched valuations with investors banking on their growth potential and ability to ride out higher commodity costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • BAYRY

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +1.7%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Bernstein, saying the outlook on...

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +1.7%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Bernstein, saying the outlook on each of the company's divisions has improved, and it expects the company's FY12 EPS to beat expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • PKT

    Shares of Procera Networks (PKT +5.4%) surge after the deep packet inspection technology company...

    Shares of Procera Networks (PKT +5.4%) surge after the deep packet inspection technology company announces a $3M follow-on order from a North American cable multiple system operator for continued geographic expansion of the MSO's PacketLogic deployment. PKT will recognize about half of the order as revenue in Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP +3.38%) moves higher after saying it's acquired exclusive rights...

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP +3.38%) moves higher after saying it's acquired exclusive rights from McGill University to intellectual property related to a potential malaria treatment. With the patent, the company hopes to capitalize on promising preclinical findings on the use of cysteamine and related compounds for the treatment of malaria.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • SFLY

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY +6.8%) gain amid estimates that its $23.8M purchase of Kodak's online...

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY +6.8%) gain amid estimates that its $23.8M purchase of Kodak's online photo service could bring in $21M in extra revenue in 2012 alone. Investors seem to be latching on to the company's promise as a leading source for ordering prints and custom merchandise on the Internet - instead of fretting over the imposing impact of a Facebook-Instagram tie-up.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +7.4%) is getting a lift from speculation Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) much-rumored...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +7.4%) is getting a lift from speculation Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) much-rumored TV set will use Cirrus' audio codec chips. Apple uses Cirrus' chips in the iPhone and iPad, and accounts for the lion's share of the company's revenue. In April, Cirrus said it's taking out a $100M credit line to support "multiple new products this fall," though speculation at the time centered around an iPad Mini.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • XSRAF

    Peru's government declared a state of emergency last night in southern Peru after deadly...

    Peru's government declared a state of emergency last night in southern Peru after deadly protests opposing Xstrata's (OTC:XSRAF +5.2%) Tintaya copper mine. Anti-mining activists have recently halted investments in several planned mines, such as Southern Copper's (SCCO +2.1%) Tia Maria project and Newmont Mining's (NEM -1.9%) Minas Conga project.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH +4.9%) pops on an upgrade to Outperform at Cowen. The firm says its...

    Accretive Health (AH +4.9%) pops on an upgrade to Outperform at Cowen. The firm says its valuation adequately reflects long-term concerns and sees a potential positive catalysts from a possible settlement sometime this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • THC

    Tenet Healthcare (THC +1.2%) moves higher despite a downgrade to Fair Value at CRT Capital...

    Tenet Healthcare (THC +1.2%) moves higher despite a downgrade to Fair Value at CRT Capital earlier today. The firm says hiring of former Community Health Systems (NYSE:CYH) exectutive Tim Adams as SVP of the Central States Region could wind up being problematic for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • FB

    Today's selloff in Facebook (FB -9.8%) is happening even though CLSA's James Lee is starting...

    Today's selloff in Facebook (FB -9.8%) is happening even though CLSA's James Lee is starting coverage with a Buy and $40 PT. Lee notes Facebook's ad click rates, a major concern for many, are much higher when an ad targets a "fan" of a product or service, and expects this trend and others to drive online ad share gains at Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) expense. On the flip side, Paul R. La Monica's talks with money managers find little interest in buying Facebook shares, mostly due to valuation concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 23 Comments
  • VALE

    Potential obstacles to Vale's (VALE +2.5%) Onca Puma nickel mine in Brazil should only minimally...

    Potential obstacles to Vale's (VALE +2.5%) Onca Puma nickel mine in Brazil should only minimally impact shares due to its current low production, Barclays says. Still, a Brazilian prosecutor's demand to halt operations due to alleged damage to Indian communities is part of an "undesirable" news flow on a sensitive subject, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • AUY

    Extorre Gold Mines (XG -12.3%) gives back gains achieved late last week on reports it adopted a...

    Extorre Gold Mines (XG -12.3%) gives back gains achieved late last week on reports it adopted a shareholder rights plan. Volume is running far ahead of normal levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +1.8%) gets a boost after Goldman added the shares to its Conviction Buy List...

    EOG Resources (EOG +1.8%) gets a boost after Goldman added the shares to its Conviction Buy List earlier today and removed ExxonMobil (XOM -0.7%) following the selloff in energy shares. The firm now expects higher-beta names to outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • TLB

    Talbots (TLB -11.3%) sinks even lower as the firm's improvement in FQ1 profits does little to...

    Talbots (TLB -11.3%) sinks even lower as the firm's improvement in FQ1 profits does little to take the sting off of a buyout deal gone south. Shares of TLB now trade at multi-year lows.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI +8.1%) soars following a report stating the image sensor vendor is "believed to...

    OmniVision (OVTI +8.1%) soars following a report stating the image sensor vendor is "believed to have secured orders" for the next-gen iPhone and iPad, and has boosted its orders to its packaging/testing partners as a result. It's added OmniVision's Q2 chip orders to TSMC (NYSE:TSM) are expected to "jump significantly" from Q1 levels. OmniVision's sensors are used in the new iPad's front and rear cameras, though it lost iPhone share to Sony with the 4S launch.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • LOJN

    Shares of LoJack (LOJN +6.1%) jump higher after a SEC filing reveals Chairman of the Board...

    Shares of LoJack (LOJN +6.1%) jump higher after a SEC filing reveals Chairman of the Board Richard Riley has bought more shares and now holds a 5.8% stake in the high-tech security systems firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • FINL

    Jefferies says there's a good chance Finish Line (FINL +1.4%) could positively preannounce Q1...

    Jefferies says there's a good chance Finish Line (FINL +1.4%) could positively preannounce Q1 earnings tomorrow ahead of its analyst day. The firm believes the company's initial guidance is too conservative and current risk/reward dynamics make the stock attractive at current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) +4.3%, with the main news being that the biotech has...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) +4.3%, with the main news being that the biotech has started a Phase 1 trial evaluating the safety and tolerability of its RenaZorb drug in healthy volunteers. RenaZorb is a potential treatment of hyperphosphatemia (high phosphate levels in the blood) in patients with chronic kidney disease. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • TEX

    Terex (NYSE:TEX) +9.45% after a bullish note from BMO Capital Markets, which predicts that...

    Terex (NYSE:TEX) +9.45% after a bullish note from BMO Capital Markets, which predicts that equipment rental companies will buy more of the Terex's cranes and aerial work platforms. The segment could "outperform expectations" over the next 12-18 months if non-residential construction spending recovers sooner or stronger than forecast, BMO says.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM +1.4%) trades up after Janney Capital upgraded the shares to Neutral on...

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM +1.4%) trades up after Janney Capital upgraded the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today. The firm cites the company's West Elm opportunity and expectations of stabilizing margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • IMPUY

    Impala Platinum's (OTCQX:IMPUY) CEO says his company will watch Anglo American's (OTCPK:AAUKY...

    Impala Platinum's (OTCQX:IMPUY) CEO says his company will watch Anglo American's (OTCPK:AAUKY +2.1%) platinum review and would be prepared to scoop up any assets if they fit within its portfolio and generate value for shareholders. Anglo American launched a review earlier this year to extract more profitability from its platinum operations against a backdrop of rising costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • FIO

    Piper's Andrew Nowinski sings Fusion-io's (FIO +4%) praises once again (previous) following a...

    Piper's Andrew Nowinski sings Fusion-io's (FIO +4%) praises once again (previous) following a meeting with management. Nowinski claims top customers Apple and Facebook are expanding their use of Fusion-io's hardware, and that Apple, which uses Fusion-io's gear to power iCloud, chose its solutions over rival offerings from NetApp and Oracle. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE) is soaring 16.1%. With no major company news, the surge could be due to...

    A123 Systems (AONE) is soaring 16.1%. With no major company news, the surge could be due to Fisker Automotive's disclosure that its hybrid electric-gasoline luxury Karma sedans generated revenue of over $100M in the first four months of the year. A123 supplies the battery packs for the Karma vehicles.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • LDK

    If major Chinese solar vendors, who now have to contend with U.S. tariffs in addition to the...

    If major Chinese solar vendors, who now have to contend with U.S. tariffs in addition to the industry's pricing and oversupply woes, continue to struggle, the Chinese government is "likely to adjust the entire supply chain," Digitimes reports. That might not go over well with governments upset over Chinese subsidies for solar vendors, but would back up reports the government favors industry consolidation. LDK Solar (LDK -12.5%), the one firm specifically named in the report, is off sharply.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • USG

    USG (USG +4.6%) moves up after being upgraded to Buy at Longbow earlier today. The firm cites...

    USG (USG +4.6%) moves up after being upgraded to Buy at Longbow earlier today. The firm cites higher wallboard volume trends and expectations for revenue acceleration.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • JOY

    Joy Global (JOY +4.7%) gets a bounce today after testing recent support, and getting a boost...

    Joy Global (JOY +4.7%) gets a bounce today after testing recent support, and getting a boost from positive comments out of Barclays that the stock is cheap at current levels. The firm says the shares already reflect the weak U.S. coal market, and downside could be limited given JOY's strong backlog and high aftermarket exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • SSN

    Samson Oil & Gas (SSN +4.1%) shares rise after the company's operations update on...

    Samson Oil & Gas (SSN +4.1%) shares rise after the company's operations update on current projects. The Spirit of America #2 well has set an intermediate seven-inch casing at a depth of 9,130 ft., which completed a "significant milestone" in securing the Permian salt section behind pipe, and a "significant" amount of free oil was recovered from samples within this interval.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI +3.6%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform on valuation at Raymond James, citing...

    SAIC (SAI +3.6%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform on valuation at Raymond James, citing the company's stable fundamentals and solid balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • THQIQ

    Beaten-down THQ (THQI -3.9%) isn't getting any relief from a 14-A in which it discloses plans to...

    Beaten-down THQ (THQI -3.9%) isn't getting any relief from a 14-A in which it discloses plans to avoid NASDAQ de-listing by carrying out a reverse stock split with a ratio anywhere from 1:3 to 1:10. THQ, in the midst of restructuring efforts it hopes will keep it afloat, was hammered last week following its FQ4 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • TSCO

    Tractor Supply (TSCO -6.5%) trades weak after Cleveland Research comes out with a note to...

    Tractor Supply (TSCO -6.5%) trades weak after Cleveland Research comes out with a note to clients tipping off that comparable-store sale trends are slowing.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -2.3%) and Western Digital (WDC -2.1%) sell off following a downgrade to Equal...

    Seagate (STX -2.3%) and Western Digital (WDC -2.1%) sell off following a downgrade to Equal Weight from Barclays' Ben Reitzes, who sees soft PC demand hurting the companies' 2H results. Reitzes also claims notebook hard drive prices, boosted by capacity shortages, are falling faster than expected, and says his checks indicate hard drive production cuts and PC inventory tightening. Moreover, he expects Apple's rumored plans to sell a cheaper MacBook Air to hurt hard drive demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOA

    North American Energy Partners (NOA +29.1%) shares skyrocket after former Helix Energy Solutions...

    North American Energy Partners (NOA +29.1%) shares skyrocket after former Helix Energy Solutions chief Martin Ferron was appointed yesterday as its new CEO, replacing the retiring Rod Ruston.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • XRX

    Xerox (XRX +3.4%) continues to transform itself from a hardware company to a services firm in a...

    Xerox (XRX +3.4%) continues to transform itself from a hardware company to a services firm in a move that it sees as essential to survival. As part of a new-look Xerox, the company has to learn to service competitor products and compete with manufacturers on a different playing field.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • DGIT

    Digital Generation (DGIT +8.7%) and SuperMedia (SPMD +6.7%) run up gains on enthusiasm tied to...

    Digital Generation (DGIT +8.7%) and SuperMedia (SPMD +6.7%) run up gains on enthusiasm tied to the pair's ability to deliver next-stage advertising solutions and M&A chatter.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +15.6%) continues its volatile trajectory, jumping higher today after...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +15.6%) continues its volatile trajectory, jumping higher today after announcing that data from studies of miRview mets2 in patients with cancer were published online in The Oncologist. The study demonstrated the ability of the miRview mets2 assay to identify 42 tumor types with high accuracy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • FB

    In spite of today's rally, Facebook (FB -5.6%) is falling to new post-IPO lows in early trading,...

    In spite of today's rally, Facebook (FB -5.6%) is falling to new post-IPO lows in early trading, and is once more taking related names down with it. ZNGA -3.9%. SVVC -1.6%. GSVC -2.3%. Investor unease with Facebook's reported plans to become a smartphone vendor could be playing a role, but the company's still-high valuation is a more likely culprit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 13 Comments
  • MGM

    Macau-related casino names run up gains after Nomura's Harry Curtis calls the group "attractive"...

    Macau-related casino names run up gains after Nomura's Harry Curtis calls the group "attractive" at current levels. The analyst sees free cash flow jumping as demand growth in Macau outruns supply growth by a good measure. MGM +4.4%, MPEL +5.1%, WYNN +3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • SNSS

    Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (SNSS +6.7%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform at RBC Capital,...

    Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (SNSS +6.7%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform at RBC Capital, citing a favorable risk/reward scenario ahead of the Q3 2012 interim analysis of its Ph III Valor trial. The firm also raises its price target to $5 from $3.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM +3.1%) follows its chip industry peers higher (SOXX +2.8%) after Nomura's Michael...

    Broadcom (BRCM +3.1%) follows its chip industry peers higher (SOXX +2.8%) after Nomura's Michael Lean adds the company to his firm's Conviction Buy list. Lean argues Broadcom's core business continue to perform well, and considers the company's valuation (13x estimated 2013 EPS) to be compelling. Maxim Integrated (MXIM +0.9%) is being removed from the list to make room.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • IACAF

    Ithaca Energy (OTCPK:IACAF -29%) shares plunge after the North Sea oil explorer says it broke...

    Ithaca Energy (OTCPK:IACAF -29%) shares plunge after the North Sea oil explorer says it broke off talks with potential buyers because their offers didn’t properly reflect the value of the company. It also agrees to a $400M debt facility from BNP Paribas that it may use “to fund ongoing development activities and future asset acquisitions.”

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • YNDX

    Russian search giant Yandex (YNDX +3.4%) catches a bid following reports Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is...

    Russian search giant Yandex (YNDX +3.4%) catches a bid following reports Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is looking to buy Face.com, in which Yandex owns a stake. A Russian paper claims Yandex wants to exchange its stake for cash and Facebook shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P -7.5%) is diving in early trading. A possible culprit is Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF)...

    Pandora (P -7.5%) is diving in early trading. A possible culprit is Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) introduction of its Music Hub service in tandem with the European launch of the Galaxy S III. However, Music Hub appears to be more of a direct rival to Spotify and Google Music than to Pandora - it allows songs to be uploaded to and streamed from the cloud, or to be streamed from a 19M-song catalog at a cost of €9.99/month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • VRTX

    Wells Fargo says today's weakness in Vertex (VRTX -20.4%) over its revised data looks excessive....

    Wells Fargo says today's weakness in Vertex (VRTX -20.4%) over its revised data looks excessive. The firm thinks the Kalydeco/'809 combo remains active and still retains multi-billion dollar potential. It would be a buyer on today's pullback.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • ENDP

    Endo Health (ENDP +4.8%) settles two patent lawsuits with Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +1.8%)...

    Endo Health (ENDP +4.8%) settles two patent lawsuits with Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +1.8%) that will allow the latter to launch a generic version of Lidoderm, Endo's $1B+ pain-relieving patch, from September 2013, pending FDA approval. Watson will pay Endo a quarter of the gross profit as royalty.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • PCXCQ

    Coal shares zoom higher after Patriot Coal (PCX +3.6%) names a new CEO and Goldman Sachs...

    Coal shares zoom higher after Patriot Coal (PCX +3.6%) names a new CEO and Goldman Sachs upgrades Peabody (BTU +5.3%) to Buy, saying it finds U.S. coal stocks “attractive” following a recent selloff. Goldman believes production cuts, higher gas prices and increased exports will help improve thermal coal prices in H2 2012. In addition to BTU, the firm calls SXC +1.7% and CNX +3.3% its favorites.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • AMZN

    As part of its efforts to ramp its mobile ad business (and thus better monetize its Kindle...

    As part of its efforts to ramp its mobile ad business (and thus better monetize its Kindle line), Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) has "kicked the tires on a few mobile-ad companies," AdAge reports. One of those companies is said to be JumpTap, one of the largest independent mobile ad networks. It's added Amazon has hired ex-Microsoft mobile marketing chief Jamie Wells to head its ad sales efforts. Millennial Media (MM +3.2%) appears to be getting a lift from AdAge's report.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +9.8%) spikes higher after JPMorgan upgrades shares to Overweight in response...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +9.8%) spikes higher after JPMorgan upgrades shares to Overweight in response to a report China Mobile (NYSE:CHL) has placed orders for low-end 3G phones from four local vendors, and that all of the phones run on Spreadtrum's baseband chips. Spreadtrum has benefited from the rapid uptake seen for China Mobile's 3G TD-SCDMA network, though concerns have been aired about competition from Marvell, MediaTek, and Qualcomm.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +4.2%) pops higher at the open after Friday's news of Carl Icahn's 7.6%...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +4.2%) pops higher at the open after Friday's news of Carl Icahn's 7.6% stake and his call for replacing at least four current board members. Oppenheimer believes rejecting Icahn's demands would prove CHK's board has not upheld its fiduciary responsibilities and would further discredit the board and CHK management.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 5 Comments

  • Market preview: Stock futures are higher, apparently cheered by polls in Greece showing a lead...

    Market preview: Stock futures are higher, apparently cheered by polls in Greece showing a lead for the pro-bailout New Democracy party. Speculation about more stimulus in China is also providing support, although that's since been refuted. S&P benchmark +0.65%. Spain's bank troubles are being shrugged off of the moment, although not in Madrid trading. Later: Consumer Confidence, State Street Investor Confidence Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • TDY

    Premarket gainers: LCRY +55%. IBI +41%. TTM +6%. PCX +6%. Losers: VRTX -21%. STD -5%.

    Premarket gainers: LCRY +55%. IBI +41%. TTM +6%. PCX +6%.
    Losers: VRTX -21%. STD -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) agrees to sell its 50% stake in the Crixas gold mine in Brazil to...

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) agrees to sell its 50% stake in the Crixas gold mine in Brazil to AngloGold Ashanti (NYSE:AU) for $220M in cash.
